desc: I require an app developer to test and refine a lecture-feedback app that has already been made, and will launch this academic year (September, 2017).  The project consists of: i) an IOS app, ii) an Android app, and iii) an Admin web service and website.Here's how the app works:When students have had a lecture, they are immediately able to go onto the app, click on the particular lecture topic and fill in the feedback questions. These questions are able to be personalised by university departments. Once the feedback questionnaire has been completed, the ratings and/or comments will automatically be sent to that lecturer's account, which will have been made by the administrator (me) already. As the administrator, I will also need to download aggregated reports on these feedback ratings, which can then be sent to appropriate department heads.What I need:The app was made via another project on Freelancer. I am happy with what was made, as it was made for both Apple and Android phones. However, the app can be further refined, and the administrator page can be made more efficient so that module/lecture details can be plugged in quickly. I therefore need someone to 1) peer-review the app and to suggest functional and aesthetic improvements, 2) refine and improve the administrator page, especially so that I can download aggregated reports , 3) ensure that students' initial details are saved so that when the next log in it will immediately show them lecture topics, 4) create user IDs for each account so that any abuse can be traced back and accounts can be deleted, 5) create filters to prevent certain abusive terms, and finally 6) create an 'accessibility mode' for anyone with dyslexia/reading difficulties with a larger font and more distinctive font colours.Further requirements:The deadline for these refinements and improvements is the end of August.Clear communications skills and high level of English proficiency are necessary.These are apps currently on the Android and Apple stores:[url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view]
title: Refine a lecture-feedback app

desc: Seeking to develop a delivery and errands mobile application engineered within the same sharing economy space as an Uber or Task Rabbit  technology for devices. This project can be any off the shelf or re-engineered software as the template. The user interface would need to be developed to reflect the  service offering for this idea (nuances that are similar but not alike to existing mobile delivery apps). Would have strong emphasis on proximity geolocation by individual devices to assign (ping) based on location to one or multiple delivery members in a proximity. Map interface similar to an Uber will be required to be built or re-engineered for real-time consumers experience (Beta would be maps for 1 to 2 Canadian cities at launch, then scale markets) you or team will be required to assist in launch and testing trials post build (ongoing TBD). Will require a secured back end and assistance in security firewall development etc. Built in e-commerce and payment system with interface for payments by credit and debit (existing interface software would be fine). Would welcome branding and user design interface assistance, so creative would be great. Overall this project is about re-engineering existing applications in market but built to reflect our unique service offering that is not met in most markets today. The delivery of a turnkey Beta ready product will be required.
title: Create a Sharing Economy Mobile Application

desc: I am looking for an experienced I-phone developer for a intermediate level project - NO AGENCIES. The project is to be done in Swift. The developer must be from Bangalore as I would like to work closely with you.The app is a real estate listing app and has features including chat, viewing real estate listings in list form and in map form, some standard account features etc.(More details in chat!)I have the design and the backend API ready with me. My main concern is that the app should look exactly like the design specification and should work fast and fluid. So only bid if you have the chops and code to prove it.The pay will be above median freelancer pay. But- AND I can't stress this ENOUGH! I need a person who knows what he is doing and can deliver a top quality app. Type garbanzo at the start of your bid so that I know you've read this description.
title: Looking for an experienced iPhone developer from Bangalore.

desc: We have defined the deliverables for the TV app and Mobile app individually below.An Android TV app which;Can play MP4 videos from a local media sourceIs recognisable on its local network as a UPnP capable deviceCan read the subtitle file of an MP4 that is being playedCan use Network Service Discovery (NSD) or similar protocols to host a service on the local networkHost a service on the local network which updates to show the current subtitles on screen in real-timeAn Android Mobile app which;Will automatically discover the service provided by the TV appWill display the subtitles on the service in real time on the screen as the MP4 is being played backSource CodeDocumentation of processes usedInstructions on how to run in a simulator/on device (for the mobile application)Here is a tutorial provided by Google to aid in developing the playback application for Android TV. ([url removed, login to view])We then also require:Network Service Discovery documentation.A final note is that the applications do not require any thought in regards to UI or UX, just the bare bones functionality is fine.
title: Build Android TV app and accompanying mobile app
